channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9055] HBaseAdmin#isTableEnabled() should return false for non-existent table
item.description:
Currently HBaseAdmin#isTableEnabled() returns true for a table which doesn't exist.

We should check table existence.
item.summary: HBaseAdmin#isTableEnabled() should return false for non-existent table

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Patch that fixes the issue along with a test.

This message is automatically generated.

In 0.94 version, isTableEnabled() returns false for a table which doesn't exist, but 0.95 return true, the related code is following:

0.95


ZKTableReadOnly

static ZooKeeperProtos.Table.State getTableState(final ZooKeeperWatcher zkw,

      final String child)

  throws KeeperException {

    String znode = ZKUtil.joinZNode(zkw.tableZNode, child);

    byte [] data = ZKUtil.getData(zkw, znode);

    if (data == null || data.length <= 0) return ZooKeeperProtos.Table.State.ENABLED;

0.94


static TableState getTableState(final ZooKeeperWatcher zkw,

      final String child)

  throws KeeperException {

    String znode = ZKUtil.joinZNode(zkw.tableZNode, child);

    byte [] data = ZKUtil.getData(zkw, znode);

    if (data == null || data.length <= 0) {

      // Null if table is enabled.

      return null;

    }

I don't know why the return value for null case is changed in above code.

If the change is ok, +1 on the patch.
Patch v3 aligns ZKTableReadOnly with logic of 0.94

Integrated to trunk.

Thanks for the review, Chunhui.

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).
